Unusual persistent network connections o.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for persistent connections to external IPs on ports not typically used for known legitimate services. Analyze connection duration and data volume for these sessions. Use time series analysis or correlation analysis to identify unusual connection patterns or spikes in traffic to suspicious destinations, correlating with known host IPs.

System activity (e.g., process execution.Action: Analyze Windows Event ID 4688 logs for process creation activity occurring without corresponding interactive logon events (e.g., Event ID 4624 type 2 or 10). Look for sequences of processes executed rapidly or in an unusual order. Correlate host activity timestamps with unusual network connection timestamps identified in Zeek logs. Use statistical analysis (e.g., frequency analysis, entropy) on executed commands to identify deviations from baseline user behavior.
